Manchester HHW Facility Program Information
materials: Glue & Adhesives; Aerosol Spray Cans; Asbestos; Brake Fluid; Compact Fluorescent Lights; Degreasers; Fertilizer; Fluorescent Lamps/Tubes; Fungicides; Gasoline and Unwanted Fuels; Herbicides; Household Cleaners; Insecticides; Mercury Containing Items; Ni-Cd Batteries; Other Batteries; Unused Paint; Paint Thinner; Pesticides; Photography Chemicals; Pool Chemicals; Batteries (Rechargeable); Solvents; Transmission Fluid
notes:
HHW events usually occur from May to October at the Manchester HHW Facility at 322 Olcott Street and usually accept muriatic acid, chemical paint strippers, no pest strips, chemistry kits, poisons, flea powder, spray and dip, polishes, fungicides, pool chemicals,  hair dye and spray, rodent killers, hearing aid batteries, slug baits, oil based stains, kerosene, lead paint, wood preservatives, and lead paint chips (double bag if wet). Please leave all materials in original containers.  This program is open to the residents of Glastonbury, Hebron, Manchester, Marlborough, Somers, Stafford, and Vernon.

2013 Schedule

April 13, 27
May 11
September 7, 21
October 19
	
8:00 am to 1:00 pm

name: Batteries Plus
materials: Compact Fluorescent Lights; Batteries (Rechargeable); Alkaline/Single-Use Batteries; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes:
Some fees for battery recycling may apply. Please contact your Local store for details.

Batteries Plus lead by example by recycling the majority of the batteries we sell. Not only do we recycle to protect our environment, we support retail and business customers alike by keeping them in full compliance with federal, state, municipal, EPA and DOT regulations governing the disposal and recycling of spent batteries and select electronics.

materials: Aluminum Cans; Brown Paper Bags; Cardboard; Catalogs; Clothing; Computer Paper; Drink Boxes; Glass (Blue); Glass (Brown); Glass (Clear); Glass (Green); Lead Acid (Pb) Batteries; Magazines; Milk Cartons; Newspapers; Office Paper; Paper (Mixed); Paperboard; Plastic #1 (PETE); Plastic #2 (HDPE); Plastic #3 (PVC); Plastic #4 (LDPE); Plastic #5 (Polypropylene); Tin or Steel Cans; Unused Paper

name: South Windsor Bulky Waste Collection
materials: Air Conditioners; Bed Mattresses; Box Springs; Carpet; Dehumidifiers; Furniture; Large Household Appliances; Refrigerators; Scrap Metal; Used Tires
notes:
Bulky items collection occurs once a month during the First Full Week of the month, beginning on Monday, on your normal refuse collection day. Bulky items must be separated from other refuse and recyclables and placed at the curb by 7:00 a.m. for collection. 
For collection of scrap metal, appliances, or items with freon you must call 860-644-2511 x 343 to arrange pick-up.
